titleStmt.title: \top line of title lost owing to moisture damage, but the bottoms of the few remaining characters are consistent with the supposition that the top line was "A faithful Inventory"\
Of the Furniture belonging to \hole\s Roo\hole\
In T: C: D
In imitation of Dr Swift's ma\hole\r
written in ye year 1725.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Quæq; ipse miserrima \hole\i. virg.
Imprimis there's a table blotted,
A tatter'd hanging all besnotted.
A Bed of flocks, as I may rankhole
Reduc'd to rug & half a blanket.
A tinder box without a flint,
An oaken desk with nothing in't.
A pair of tongs, bought from a broker,
A Fender, & a rusty poker.
A penny pot & bason, this
design'd for water, that for piss.
A broken winded pair of bellows,
Two knives & forks, but neither fellows.
Item a Surplice, not un meeting
Either for table-cloth or Sheeting.
There is likewise a pair of breeches,
But patch'd, and fallen in the Stitches,
Hung up in Study very little,
Playster'd with cobwebs, ink & Spittle.hole·········· osp······ all So pleasing
From hole light Window wthout glazing
A Trhole & a College-bottle,
Pil'd hole on Locke & Aristotle.
A P?damage-book which he Seldom handles,A savholell, and two del·farth farthing candles.
A Smuty ballad, musty libel,
A Burgersdicius & a bible.
The Chole?sars, Seasons & the Senses
By Overton, to Save expences.
Item (if I am not ins by Swiftmuch mistaken)
A Mouse-trap with a bit of bacon.
A Candlholestick without a Snuffer,
Whereby his fingers often Suffer.
Two odd old Shoes I Should not Skip here,
Each Strapless Serves instead of Slipper.
And Chairs a Couple, I forgot 'em,
But each of them without a bott
Thus I in Rhyme have comprehended
His goods, & So my Schedule's ended.!W08363H
